chapter.title: History
chapter.para: History is the component that captures what happened during process execution and stores it permanently. In contrast to the runtime data, the history data will remain present in the DB also after process instances have completed.
Currently, there are 2 history tables: ACT_HI_PROC_INST containing a record for every process instance and ACT_HI_ACT_INST containing a record for every execution of an activity.

In the API, the HistoryService exposes this information by offering methods createHistoricProcessInstanceQuery and createHistoricActivityInstanceQuery. You might want to consider these querying these tables in order to minimize access to the runtime process instance data and that way keeping the runtime execution performant.
Later on, this information will be exposed in Activiti Explorer and Activiti Probe. Also, it will be the information from which the reports will be generated.
